intro: Pharus cornutus, commonly known as the horned pharus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive horn-like structures on its stems, which are thought to play a role in defense or water retention. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Pharus cornutus is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it has adapted to thrive with minimal water.
